attributes.trait_type: puff pastry, thawed (See bottom of recipe)

attributes.value:
Instructions:
Prepare the Filling:

Boil the potatoes in a large pot of salted water until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and mash the potatoes.
In a skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Combine the mashed potatoes, sautéed onions, beaten eggs, sour cream, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Mix well.
Prepare the Puff Pastry:

Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Roll out the puff pastry sheets on a lightly floured surface. Cut each sheet into 9 squares.
Assemble the Knishes:

Place a spoonful of the potato mixture in the center of each puff pastry square.
Fold the corners of the pastry over the filling to form a neat square or triangle. Pinch the edges to seal.
Place the knishes on the prepared baking sheet and brush with the beaten egg for the egg wash.
Bake:

Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown.
(Go ahead, and look up on this interweb site, my recipe for Puff Pastries.  Thanks, Bubala)
